member.name: T:TweetNET.Requests.Streaming.Statuses.FilterRequest
member.summary: Class used for requesting public statuses that match one or more filter predicates.
member.remarks:
Multiple parameters may be specified which allows most clients to use a single connection to the Streaming API. Both GET and POST requests are supported, but GET requests with too many parameters may cause the request to be rejected for excessive URL length. Use a POST request to avoid long URLs.
The track, follow, and locations fields should be considered to be combined with an OR operator. track=foo&follow=1234 returns Tweets matching "foo" OR created by user 1234.
The default access level allows up to 400 track keywords, 5,000 follow userids and 25 0.1-360 degree location boxes. If you need elevated access to the Streaming API, you should explore our partner providers of Twitter data here.

member.name: T:TweetNET.Requests.Timelines.Statuses.UserTimelineRequest
member.summary: Class used for requesting a collection of the most recent Tweets posted by a specified user
member.remarks:
User timelines belonging to protected users may only be requested when the authenticated user either "owns" the timeline or is an approved follower of the owner.
The timeline returned is the equivalent of the one seen when you view a user's profile on twitter.com. This method can only return up to 3,200 of a user's most recent Tweets. Native retweets of other statuses by the user is included in this total, regardless of whether include_rts is set to false when requesting this resource.

member.name: M:TweetNET.Requests.Timelines.Statuses.UserTimelineRequest.#ctor(System.String,TweetNET.OAuth.SecurityTokens)
member.summary: Creates a new instance
member.param: The twitter handle of the user whose timeline is being retrieved
object containing all of the oAuth keys, tokens and secrets used to authorize the request

member.name: P:TweetNET.Requests.Timelines.Statuses.UserTimelineRequest.User_ID
member.summary:
(one of and must be set)
ID of the user for whom to return results for.

member.name: P:TweetNET.Requests.Timelines.Statuses.UserTimelineRequest.Screen_Name
member.summary:
(one of and must be set)
The screen name of the user for whom to return results for.

member.name: P:TweetNET.Requests.Timelines.Statuses.UserTimelineRequest.Since_ID
member.summary: (optional) - Returns results with an ID greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified ID.
member.remarks: There are limits to the number of Tweets which can be accessed through the API. If the limit of Tweets has occured since the since_id, the since_id will be forced to the oldest ID available.

member.name: P:TweetNET.Requests.Timelines.Statuses.UserTimelineRequest.Count
member.summary: (optional) - Specifies the number of tweets to try and retrieve, up to a maximum of 200 per distinct request.
member.remarks: The value of count is best thought of as a limit to the number of tweets to return because suspended or deleted content is removed after the count has been applied. We include retweets in the count, even if include_rts is not supplied. It is recommended you always send include_rts=1 when using this API method.

member.name: P:TweetNET.Requests.Timelines.Statuses.UserTimelineRequest.Max_ID
member.summary: (optional) - Returns results with an ID less than (that is, older than) or equal to the specified ID.

member.name: P:TweetNET.Requests.Timelines.Statuses.UserTimelineRequest.Trim_User
member.summary:
(optional) - When set to either true, t or 1, each tweet returned in a timeline will include a user object including only the status authors numerical ID.
Omit this parameter to receive the complete user object.

member.name: P:TweetNET.Requests.Timelines.Statuses.UserTimelineRequest.Exclude_Replies
member.summary: (optional) - This parameter will prevent replies from appearing in the returned timeline.
member.remarks: Using exclude_replies with the count parameter will mean you will receive up-to count tweets â€” this is because the count parameter retrieves that many tweets before filtering out retweets and replies. This parameter is only supported for JSON and XML responses.

member.name: P:TweetNET.Requests.Timelines.Statuses.UserTimelineRequest.Contributor_Details
member.summary:
(optional) - This parameter enhances the contributors element of the status response to include the screen_name of the contributor.
By default only the user_id of the contributor is included.

member.name: P:TweetNET.Requests.Timelines.Statuses.UserTimelineRequest.Include_RTS
member.summary: (optional) - When set to false, the timeline will strip any native retweets (though they will still count toward both the maximal length of the timeline and the slice selected by the count parameter).
member.remarks: Note: If you're using the trim_user parameter in conjunction with include_rts, the retweets will still contain a full user object.

member.name: T:TweetNET.Requests.Search.TweetsRequest
member.summary: Class used for requesting a collection of relevant Tweets matching a specified query.
member.remarks:
In API v1.1, the response format of the Search API has been improved to return Tweet objects more similar to the objects you'll find across the REST API and platform. You may need to tolerate some inconsistencies and variance in perspectival values (fields that pertain to the perspective of the authenticating user) and embedded user objects.
Please note that Twitter's search service and, by extension, the Search API is not meant to be an exhaustive source of Tweets. Not all Tweets will be indexed or made available via the search interface.

member.name: M:TweetNET.Requests.Search.TweetsRequest.#ctor(System.String,TweetNET.OAuth.SecurityTokens)
member.summary: Creates a new instance
member.param: UTF-8, URL-encoded search query (see the property)
The object holding the security keys, tokens, and secrets assigned by Twitter

member.name: P:TweetNET.Requests.Search.TweetsRequest.Q
member.summary:
(required) - A UTF-8, URL-encoded search query of 1,000 characters maximum, including operators.
Queries may additionally be limited by complexity.

member.name: P:TweetNET.Requests.Search.TweetsRequest.Geocode
member.summary: (optional) - Returns tweets by users located within a given radius of the given latitude/longitude.
member.remarks: The location is preferentially taking from the Geotagging API, but will fall back to their Twitter profile. The parameter value is specified by "latitude,longitude,radius", where radius units must be specified as either "mi" (miles) or "km" (kilometers). Note that you cannot use the near operator via the API to geocode arbitrary locations; however you can use this geocode parameter to search near geocodes directly. A maximum of 1,000 distinct "sub-regions" will be considered when using the radius modifier.

member.name: P:TweetNET.Requests.Search.TweetsRequest.Lang
member.summary: (optional) - Restricts tweets to the given language, given by an ISO 639-1 code. Language detection is best-effort.

member.name: P:TweetNET.Requests.Search.TweetsRequest.Locale
member.summary: (optional) - Specify the language of the query you are sending (only ja is currently effective).
member.remarks: This is intended for language-specific consumers and the default should work in the majority of cases.

member.name: P:TweetNET.Requests.Search.TweetsRequest.Result_Type
member.summary:
(optional) - Specifies what type of search results you would prefer to receive.
The current default is "mixed." Valid values include:
mixed: Include both popular and real time results in the response.
recent: return only the most recent results in the response
popular: return only the most popular results in the response.

member.name: P:TweetNET.Requests.Search.TweetsRequest.Count
member.summary: (optional) - The number of tweets to return per page, up to a maximum of 100. Defaults to 15.
member.remarks: This was formerly the "rpp" parameter in the old Search API.

member.name: P:TweetNET.Requests.Search.TweetsRequest.Until
member.summary:
(optional) - Returns tweets generated before the given date.
Date should be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.
member.remarks: Keep in mind that the search index may not go back as far as the date you specify here.

member.name: P:TweetNET.Requests.Search.TweetsRequest.Since_ID
member.summary: (optional) - Returns results with an ID greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified ID.
member.remarks: There are limits to the number of Tweets which can be accessed through the API. If the limit of Tweets has occured since the since_id, the since_id will be forced to the oldest ID available.

member.name: P:TweetNET.Requests.Search.TweetsRequest.Max_ID
member.summary: (optional) - Returns results with an ID less than (that is, older than) or equal to the specified ID.

member.name: P:TweetNET.Requests.Search.TweetsRequest.Include_Entities
member.summary: (optional) - The entities node will be disincluded when set to false.

member.name: P:TweetNET.Requests.Search.TweetsRequest.Callback
member.summary: (optional) - If supplied, the response will use the JSONP format with a callback of the given name.
member.remarks: The usefulness of this parameter is somewhat diminished by the requirement of authentication for requests to this endpoint.
